title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 January 2016 - XWiki
content:

09:49 <vmassol> good morning  
09:49 <vmassol> BFD?  
09:51 <Enygma`> mornin`  
09:51 <Enygma`> yep, will set it up  
09:51 <vmassol> hi Enygma`  
09:51 <vmassol> ok thx  
09:57 <martinus\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <Enygma`> BFD#91 is on! :)  
10:15 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ? :)  
10:15 <gdelhumeau> I'll delete it afterwards :)  
10:15 <vmassol> when clicked this generates a xar for me  
10:16 <gdelhumeau> I could have use only the preview button actually  
10:25 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:33 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <mflorea> has quit  
10:46 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:47 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <tmortagne> Enygma`: [ERROR] src/main/java/org/xwiki/refactoring/internal/splitter/DefaultDocumentSplitter.java:[161,5] (metrics) CyclomaticComplexity: Cyclomatic Complexity is 11 (max allowed is 10).  
10:53 <Enygma`> tmortagne: just noticed it  
10:54 <Enygma`> there are other tests that need some setup fixed, I`ll get on it. Thanks  
11:22 <vmassol> evalica: good morning  
11:23 <vmassol> WDYT of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1342# ? Should we keep it or close it?  
12:38 <XwikiUserRodrigo> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <XwikiUserRodrigo> hello  
12:38 <XwikiUserRodrigo> need some quick (i assume) help in override a skin style  
12:39 <XwikiUserRodrigo> I'm trying to remove the left/right padding on .main, and I define on the theme css (using Advanced on the theme editor), but it's always overriden by the main skin css  
12:40 <XwikiUserRodrigo> any hints?  
12:45 <lucaa> has quit  
12:46 <vmassol> hi, I don't really know the answer  
12:46 <vmassol> but you could try using a SSX or override the CSS in a custom skin (you just need to override the style.css)  
12:46 <vmassol> you could also report the issue or send a mail on the list in case someone knows how to do that with the theme editor  
12:46 <vmassol> maybe someone else is going to answer here later on (it's lunch time for a lot of people atm)  
12:51 <gdelhumeau> XwikiUserRodrigo: use "absolute;" maybe  
12:51 <gdelhumeau> the fact is the css rules applying on .main are very precise:  
12:51 <gdelhumeau> example: #body.content.panel-left-width-Small.panel-right-width-Medium .main {  
12:52 <gdelhumeau> so you need to overwrite these rules  
12:52 <gdelhumeau> sorry not absolute, I meant "!important"  
13:01 <XwikiUserRodrigo> !important worked just fine for this. Thank you!  
13:02 <XwikiUserRodrigo> not sure if this the place to ask.. but is the Jay Skin technical documentation skin planned for implementation? It would fit my purpose beautifully  
13:12 <vmassol> XwikiUserRodrigo: regarding http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/JaySkin  
13:12 <vmassol> yes AFAIK evalica would like to implement it and put it on xwiki.org  
13:13 <vmassol> I know that evalica is going to work on xwiki.org in the coming 3 months but I don't know the extent of what she's going to do and if it includes developing this skin  
13:13 <vmassol> evalica: ?  
13:24 <evalica> the work for xwiki.org does not include the Jay Skin. It will be another proposal with other look.  
13:26 <vmassol> evalica: so you don't plan to change the xwiki.org skin (will be flamingo), just some small customizations for the look?  
13:27 <vmassol> can you also confirm that the jay skin is not dead, just watiing to be implemented and that we're interested in having it for xwiki.org?  
13:28 <evalica> the skin on xwiki.org - yes it will be flamingo with customizations. Regarding Jay it is a proposal for a documentation skin - but nothing is planned regarding xwiki.org  
13:29 <vmassol> k, thx  
13:40 <msmeria> has quit  
13:44 <XwikiUserRodrigo> so.. if I uderstood correctly.. Jay skin will eventually become a skin extension, but no timeframe is defined at this point?  
13:45 <vmassol> correcdt  
13:45 <vmassol> \*correct  
13:46 <vmassol> however you can already using the Navigation Panel  
13:46 <vmassol> put it as a left panel  
13:46 <vmassol> (remove the app panel)  
13:46 <vmassol> add the search panel on the left too if you wish  
13:47 <vmassol> i think the latest flamingo skin in XWiki 7.4 looks better for doc sites (cleaner/simpler)  
13:47 <vmassol> (don't know what version of xwiki you're using)  
13:48 <XwikiUserRodrigo> 7.4. indeed.  
13:48 <XwikiUserRodrigo> and the skin is fine indeed, and it was one of the reasons I went with Xwiki  
13:49 <vmassol> we simplified it in 7.2, 7.3 and 7.4  
13:49 <XwikiUserRodrigo> but.. then I saw Jay.. and it looks even better :) Great work there.  
13:49 <vmassol> ok cool to know :)  
13:50 <XwikiUserRodrigo> I'm on my first steps with Xwiki, and I come from a Foswiki past. But here at my new company everyone is more Java oriented, so that was a plus for xwiki here. And SQL backend, SOLR and REST. Nice package!  
13:51 <vmassol> ah cool, very intersted to hear more about how xwiki fare vs foswiki. If you could send a quick review after using xwiki a bit that would help the xwiki community a lot (to learn what we could improve and see what we're doing better/worse)  
13:59 <XwikiUserRodrigo> that's a good idea! will do it for sure  
14:04 <XwikiUserRodrigo> evalica: can you share what was the font you used in Jay?  
14:13 <vmassol> thanks!  
14:17 <evalica> XwikiUserRodrigo: It's Open Sans - wait a second  
14:20 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <evalica> XwikiUserRodrigo: yes - it's Open Sans for content + Source Code Pro for code samples  
14:22 <XwikiUserRodrigo> great, many thanks!  
14:28 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:54 <Aison0> hello, everytime I set [[label>>||anchor="some\_anchor"]] the anchor=".." part is deleted after saving  
14:54 <Aison0> very strange  
14:57 <vmassol> indeed very strange. Never seen this myself.  
14:57 <vmassol> oops meeting time, bbiab, leaving others to help you out Aison0 :)
